column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Good morning !
#Text=So remember how yesterday when I showed you the thingy thing there were like very high waves in the lagoon ?
#Text=Well , today is like the exact opposite .
#Text=This is like the calmest water you might have seen .
#Text=This is so beautiful .
#Text=And I 'm drinking instant coffee , but the instant coffee is actually from Bremen .
#Text=That 's crazy , right ?
#Text=In South Africa I 'm drinking instant coffee that is from Bremen .
#Text=Not the best representation of my city I guess , because it 's instant coffee .
#Text=We are heading out here at 10:00 a.m. I think , and then on the way back we 're stopping at a winery for , I do n't know , for looking at it , and then we 're gon na head back .
#Text=So firstly the Sauvignon Blanc which is for you , for you sir .
#Text=So the Sauvignon Blanc , it 's naturally high - acidic grape , and then if you smell it you pick up grassy aromas , lots of passion fruits , gooseberry flavors in the palate .
#Text=So this is a warmer climate Sauvignon Blanc , well balanced acidity , 2018 vintage , very crisp and fresh and it is unwooded .

#Text=And then the Chardonnay - Pinot Noir , it is a blended wine of 60 % Chardonnay and 40 % Pinot Noir , so it 's more like a dry rosé style of wine with lots of strawberry flavors , hints of yellow apple , and it 's 2018 vintage , which is unwooded .
#Text=It 's very fresh and crisp .
#Text=Okay ?
#Text=Is it a popular wine ?
#Text=Chardonnay ?
#Text=Yes , in South Africa Chardonnay and Pinot Noir , it 's a popular wine .
#Text=Interesting .

#Text=And then with the Chardonnay , Chardonnay is naturally high - acidic , but not so much aromatic on the nose , so you pick up lots of citrus fruits , limes , lemons on the palate , and this is 2017 vintage , also unwooded .
#Text=So these are the type of wine that you can enjoy on their own and also with your light meals , because they are made to open now , drink now wines .
#Text=Can I ask you , with your white wines , how – how long – when 's the best time to drink them ?
#Text=Is it sooner ?
#Text=Yes , yes , sooner .
#Text=It 's open now drink now wines , as I said they are lifestyle wines , easy drinking , everyday drinking styles .
#Text=But if you want to keep them , I would say 5 years in the cellar .
#Text=Oh , you can ?
#Text=Yes you can keep them in your cellar , and then the red wines , six years to seven years , not more than that .
#Text=And then with the red wines from the Signature they only spent eight months in the French oak .
#Text=So the reason behind that shorter period of time is for you to get more of the original flavors from the grapes , not so much of the secondary flavor since they are more level entry wines .
#Text=So the Pinotage is a uniquely grown South African grape .
#Text=It was discovered in the year of 1925 by a professor called Abraham Perold in the University of Stellenbosch .
#Text=So it 's a high grade grape that is made from Pinot Noir and the Hermitage .
#Text=You took a stem of both , cross-breeded them .
#Text=The Hermitage is known as the Cinsault today .
#Text=So the Pinotage is very aromatic , has lots of plum fruits , red fruit flavors .
#Text=The tanins are full of high tanins , but they are quite soft .

#Text=This is a 2017 vintage and then the Shiraz , it 's known for its biasing characteristics , that what you pick up on the palette on the nose to the palate , spicy peppery flavor , has lots of great fruits and this is 2017 vintage .
#Text=And then the Cab , the Cabernet is known for its thick uh skin and it 's known for when it 's blended , it always acts as a backbone to the wine .
#Text=So since this one had not much of the oak barrel you pick up the original black currant fruits , pencil shavings aromas , has lots of black cherries as well .
#Text=This is the 2017 vintage .
#Text=So this –
#Text=So , so with th- with these people , it 's better to wait for these as well , even though they 're your everyday –
#Text=Would it be better to like say –
#Text=Yes , three years ' time , four years ' time , yes .
#Text=Remember , while it gets better with age , so , these also .
#Text=OK , any questions ?
#Text=Thank you !
#Text=That 's good !
#Text=Yeah .
#Text=Enjoy !
#Text=I will bring the cheese platter .
#Text=Thank you !
#Text=So you heard it people : whatever she said .
#Text=To make it a real wine tasting , we also got a cheese platter .
#Text=Got some cheese !
#Text=I 'm just smelling the wine .
#Text=So we just saw a wine tasting , and got to say it was really good .
#Text=They gave us a little wine .
#Text=I feel like my sunburn adds nicely to the effect .
#Text=Wooh !
#Text=I actually spit it , all of it , in here .
#Text=Actually no .
#Text=No you did n't .
#Text=Yeah , I drank all of it .
#Text=But you see all of these glasses ?
#Text=I drank all of them .
#Text=No you actually drank a few sips –
#Text=He 's lying , you drank – you drank most of them .
#Text=I 've been called out !
#Text=No but this one , this one was really really good .
#Text=What 's your recap ?
#Text=Uh –
#Text=My recap ?
#Text=No which one 's your favorite wine ?
#Text=Just say your favorite wine .
#Text=My favorite wine is the Creative Block , yeah Creative Block 5 .
#Text=What 's in there ?
#Text=It is a blend of Merlot , Cabernet Sauvignon , Cabernet Franc , Malbec , and Petit Verdot .
#Text=Got it .
#Text=So what was your favorite ?
#Text=My favorite was the Signature Sauvignon Blanc from Spier .
#Text=Lovely , lovely wine .
#Text=Crisp , fruity , fresh everyday wine , good to have with fish and maybe chicken .
#Text=So it 's a white wine .
#Text=Yeah , it 's a white wine .
#Text=So , white wine for you , white wine for me .
#Text=For me it was actually the Creative Block 3 , was this one , with Shiraz , Mourvèdre , Viognier .
#Text=Actually all of us did n't choose the most expensive one .
#Text=Yeah , we did n't .
#Text=We had one of the very expensive ones , and actually none of us liked it the most .
#Text=We all liked the inexpensive version of the Pinotage more .
#Text=So , was a really good experience , and I 'll , you know , got ta head home .
#Text=He 's driving , not me .

#Text=Radiology resident Dr Thomas Smyth will be writing on this next week 's radiology rotation at the British Academy , giving his views from the perspective of the flimsy pregnancy , and the questions raised by his fellow trainee vloggers .
